title: Idries Shah
summary: Idries Shah (/ˈɪdrɪs ˈʃɑː/; Pashto: ادريس شاه‎, Urdu: ادریس شاه‎; 16 June 1924 – 23 November 1996), also known as Idris Shah, né Sayed Idries el-Hashimi (Arabic: سيد إدريس هاشمي) and by the pen name Arkon Daraul, was an author, a teacher in the Sufi tradition and a leading thinker of the 20th century. Shah wrote over three dozen books on topics ranging from psychology and spirituality to travelogues and culture studies.
